intro: Pouteria torta subsp. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate soursop, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by edible, spiny fruits resembling those of the soursop. Its fruit contains a white, juicy pulp with numerous black seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit. The subspecies is distinguished by the presence of tubercles on its young leaves and fruits.
